hero.core_tension: A measured choice between front-loading demand (Early Holiday window) and conserving inventory for a Black Friday peak — depicted as a forward-leaning demand wave opposing a held reserve.
hero.setting: Flagship planning table, three-quarter low-angle over the surface; storefront light through high windows, clean negative space, weathered wood table and matte paper schedules.
hero.persona: Senior operator (merchant) and studio producer collaborating side-by-side — hands-on, decisive.
hero.action: Arranging tiered offer tabs and sample SKUs into two visible stacks while sketching annotations on a linen notecard.
hero.urgency_symbol: A staggered fan of folded offer tickets leaning toward the Early Holiday stack (suggests momentum without literal clocks).
props: tiered offer cards (Nov 12–30) that read as tactile swatches
studio headset folded on the table
hero.lighting: Polished editorial lighting with confident highlights on hands and cards, soft fill to preserve clean negative space.
hero.alt: Two people leaning over a flagship planning table under polished editorial light; one arranges tiered offer cards fanned toward an early-holiday stack while the other holds a sample SKU, symbolizing the choice to front‑load offers.

signal_map.structure: Overhead geometry of concentric rings with radial arcs and a dotted lattice — implied systems topology (rings for timing windows, arcs for customer flows).
elements: laminated cohort tokens (loyalty tiers, walk-in customers, broad market)
stacked inventory markers at radial nodes
curved path arcs indicating footfall and online-to-store routing
signal_map.motion: Arcing flows that sweep outward from an inner early-window ring toward outer deep-discount nodes, with intermittent pauses suggesting measured rollouts.
signal_map.palette: Muted holiday neutrals with deep cranberry and warm brass accents; materials: matte paper, brushed metal tokens, frosted acrylic overlays for clean highlights.
signal_map.alt: Overhead editorial shot of a signal map built from concentric rings and arcs in muted holiday tones; tokens and markers show cohort paths and inventory nodes to illustrate timing and flow.

case_studies.scene: Backroom operations table, overhead 45° angle; tactile materials: corrugated boxes, kraft tags, stainless clipboards.
case_studies.moment: A/B test kickoff: a split row of offer packets — one row fanning forward (Early Holiday), one stacked conservative (Black Friday-only) — tension shown as a careful measuring of supply vs push.
case_studies.persona: Fulfillment lead and merchandising operator conferring over pick lists.
props: paired offer packets labeled by cohort
measured ribbon or tally strip indicating allocation
case_studies.lighting: Confident highlights on hands and paperwork, soft shadows to maintain clear negative space.
case_studies.alt: Fulfillment lead and merch operator at a backroom table with split offer packets and fulfillment dockets under crisp editorial light, preparing an A/B test between Early Holiday and Black Friday plans.

case_studies.scene: Storefront activation mock-up, eye-level three-quarter shot toward the parade-facing window; materials: polished acrylic display, fabric bunting.
case_studies.moment: Pre-show setup for a parade-linked activation: team arranging an exclusive parade-themed SKU and portable stream rig — the scene captures local demand being primed versus everyday traffic.
case_studies.persona: Store events manager and studio producer coordinating the window display and live-stream rig.
props: parade-themed product sample on a riser
portable camera rig with folded cable
flag-themed fabric swatch and small crowd-control rope
case_studies.lighting: Polished editorial key light on the SKU with rim light on faces, abundant negative space to isolate the activation.
case_studies.alt: Events manager and studio producer set a parade-themed SKU in a flagship window under editorial lighting, with a portable camera rig nearby — a poised moment before a live activation to drive footfall.

case_studies.scene: Merchandising war-room table, overhead wide shot; composition includes sample shelving mock and matte finish price-tag strips.
case_studies.moment: Switching from one deep markdown to segmented promotions: trays of loyalty-tagged items, targeted price strips, and clustered product groupings show the decision to segment offers.
case_studies.persona: Loyalty manager and pricing analyst laying out segmented promotions and loyalty early-access materials.
props: loyalty card stack and laminated member token
segmented price tags in three tiers
clustered product samples on sample shelving
case_studies.lighting: Clean editorial fill with confident highlights on the loyalty token and price strips, negative space around groupings.
case_studies.alt: Loyalty manager and pricing analyst at a merchandising table arranging segmented price tags and loyalty tokens under polished light, illustrating replacing a single deep markdown with targeted promotions.
